Operation 'DeleteAlias' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_side_effects. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about permanence, side effects (removal of configurations and data), and account ownership requirement. Enhanced version clarifies the destructive nature of the operation and helps AI agents understand the consequences.

data.current_description: Deletes a single alias by providing alias and domain. If no domain is provided the API will search for the matching alias within the Short.fyi domain
data.summary_suggestion: Delete a short URL alias permanently
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a single alias (short URL) by specifying its alias name and domain. If no domain is provided, the API searches within the default Short.fyi domain. This operation is irreversible and will remove all associated redirect configurations, destinations, and tracking data for the alias. Requires the alias to be linked to your account.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about permanence, side effects (removal of configurations and data), and account ownership requirement. Enhanced version clarifies the destructive nature of the operation and helps AI agents understand the consequences.

If no domain is provided, searches within the default Short.fyi domain. Requires the alias to be linked to your account.

message: Operation 'CreateAlias' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks information about random alias generation, return values, and uniqueness constraints. Enhanced version explains the full capability including destination matching, random generation, override behavior, and return values for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
This POST method creates a new alias under a specified domain. If no domain is specified in the request the alias will be attached to the default domain Short.fyi 

 **NOTE:** You can override the domain level Meta Tags and Tracking Snippets by specifying them for each URL. Any variables you add to a specific URL will always override domain level settings.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new short URL with optional custom alias
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new short URL (alias) under a specified domain with configurable redirect destinations. If no domain is specified, the alias is attached to the default Short.fyi domain. Supports random alias generation (7-character string) if alias is not provided or is empty. Allows configuration of default destination, country-specific destinations, OS-specific destinations, meta tags, and tracking snippets. URL-level meta tags and snippets override domain-level defaults. Returns the created alias, full short URL, and associated configuration. Alias must be unique within its domain.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks information about random alias generation, return values, and uniqueness constraints. Enhanced version explains the full capability including destination matching, random generation, override behavior, and return values for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'UpdateAlias' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too generic. Description is verbose with formatting issues and unclear about partial vs. complete updates. Enhanced version clarifies the partial update behavior, array replacement semantics, override behavior, and return value in a more structured way for AI agent clarity.

data.current_description:
Update a single short URL by providing its alias and domain as a parameter, and the data you wish to update in the body of the request. If no domain is provided you will receive the alias found attached to the Short.fyi domain (if it exists and is linked to your account!)

 ### NOTE: 

 ( * )If you add a metatag or a snippet with a same name to an alias and the domain it's related to, the value will be taken from the alias and not the domain 

 ( ** ) When you update any array property (like destinations) the block is updated **completely** so you have to specify the old records to avoid deleting them

 ( *** ) The method updates only the specified properties so if there was no change in one of them you don't have to send it.
data.summary_suggestion: Update short URL configuration and destinations
data.description_suggestion: Updates an existing short URL (alias) by specifying its alias name and domain as parameters, with update data in the request body. If no domain is provided, searches within the default Short.fyi domain. Supports partial updates - only specified properties are modified. For array properties (destinations, meta tags, snippets), the entire array is replaced, so include all desired records to avoid deletion. URL-level meta tags and snippets override domain-level defaults. Returns the updated alias configuration. Requires the alias to be linked to your account.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description is verbose with formatting issues and unclear about partial vs. complete updates. Enhanced version clarifies the partial update behavior, array replacement semantics, override behavior, and return value in a more structured way for AI agent clarity.

message: Operation 'GetAliases' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is incomplete - doesn't mention pagination. Description is verbose and unclear about pagination mechanics. Enhanced version clarifies pagination behavior and parameters, making it clearer for AI agents how to iterate through large result sets.

data.current_description:
Obtain a list of all alias names associated with your account and given domain. Result array is in descending order by creation date. 

 If no domain is specified you will receive a list of all the alias names you have created using the Short.fyi domain. 

 If there are more results than the limit for the request the response will return you a value in lastId property you can specify it in the continueFrom query parameter to get the next batch of records.
data.summary_suggestion: List all aliases for a domain with pagination
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all aliases (short URLs) associated with your account for a specified domain. Results are ordered in descending order by creation date. If no domain is specified, returns aliases from the default Short.fyi domain. Supports pagination via limit and continueFrom parameters. When results exceed the limit, the response includes a lastId value that can be passed as the continueFrom parameter to retrieve the next batch of records.
data.reasoning: Original summary is incomplete - doesn't mention pagination. Description is verbose and unclear about pagination mechanics. Enhanced version clarifies pagination behavior and parameters, making it clearer for AI agents how to iterate through large result sets.

message: Operation 'GetClicks' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context. Original summary is too vague - doesn't indicate this is analytics data. Description lacks information about what click data is returned (location, OS, referrer, etc.). Enhanced version specifies the types of data returned and clarifies the pagination mechanism for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
Retrieve the raw click data for your account. Clicks are retrieved by creation date in descending order. 

 If there are more results than the limit for the request the response will return you a value in lastId property you can specify it in the continueFrom query parameter to get the next batch of records.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve raw click analytics data with pagination
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves raw click data for all short URLs associated with your account, ordered by click date in descending order. Returns detailed click information including timestamp, user location (country), device OS, and referrer data. Supports pagination via limit and continueFrom parameters. When results exceed the limit, the response includes a lastId value that can be passed as the continueFrom parameter to retrieve the next batch of records. Useful for analyzing traffic patterns and user engagement across all aliases.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too vague - doesn't indicate this is analytics data. Description lacks information about what click data is returned (location, OS, referrer, etc.). Enhanced version specifies the types of data returned and clarifies the pagination mechanism for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'GetStatistics' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_context, inconsistent_terminology. Original summary uses 'clicks statistics' which is inconsistent with 'click data' terminology used in GetClicks. Description is too brief and doesn't explain filtering capabilities or what statistics are returned. Enhanced version clarifies the aggregation/filtering distinction from GetClicks, explains the ClicksFilterModel usage, and specifies the types of statistics returned.

data.current_description: Retrieve the raw click statistics for your account. Clicks are retrieved by creation date in descending order.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve aggregated click statistics with filtering
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves aggregated click statistics for your account with optional filtering by alias, domain, country, and OS. Supports filtering via the ClicksFilterModel request body to analyze traffic patterns for specific short URLs, geographic regions, or device types. Returns statistical summaries including click counts, geographic distribution, device breakdown, and temporal trends. Results are ordered by creation date in descending order. Useful for performance analysis and audience insights across your short URLs.
data.reasoning: Original summary uses 'clicks statistics' which is inconsistent with 'click data' terminology used in GetClicks. Description is too brief and doesn't explain filtering capabilities or what statistics are returned. Enhanced version clarifies the aggregation/filtering distinction from GetClicks, explains the ClicksFilterModel usage, and specifies the types of statistics returned.
